Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2009 09:33PM RuthieRR8 wrote: Sooipro sorry for these difficulties.  You're in NY-get a second opinion-which you should always do anyway no matter what the diagnosis.  Tell your primary doc you're not comfortable with that result-go to someone else right away to ease your fears.  Hopefully the next results will be more definitive-if the same, then you can feel more comfortable that it is "you".  Needle biopsy is not pleasant at best but go for it anyway.  I'm at the other end of that, having had surgery etc.  But I definitely had 2nd opinion -1st from Sloan Kettering (Dr. Deborah Capco) & 2nd from St. Luke's (Dr. Esterbrooke, both great women docs.  Hope this helps...I'm from PA but it was worth the trips.  You have no end of resources in your area.
Posts.Title: recieved 2 different diagnoses today... Klawless9 swest
